intro: Loxoscaphe theciferum, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often tinged with red. Loxoscaphe theciferum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
